thread.title: Lillard, McCollum lead Blazers' big rally to beat Jazz in OT
thread.title_full: Lillard, McCollum lead Blazers' big rally to beat Jazz in OT

author: The Associated Press
title: Lillard, McCollum lead Blazers' big rally to beat Jazz in OT
text:
Lillard, McCollum lead Blazers' big rally to beat Jazz in OT By The Associated Press | Posted Oct 18th, 2015 @ 10:00pm  3 photos  Blazers rally by Jazz in overtime of preseason game 
PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) — Damian Lillard scored 32 points, C.J. McCollum had 26 and the Portland Trail Blazers rallied from a 21-point, second-half deficit to beat the Utah Jazz 116-111 in overtime Sunday night in a preseason game. 
Lillard, who hit two free throws with 2.8 seconds left to tie the game at 101 and force overtime, made six 3-pointers. McCollum hit 11 of 23 shots and scored 18 points during the fourth quarter and overtime for Portland (3-2). 
Trey Burke scored 22 points and Joe Ingles came off the bench to hit five 3-pointers scored 16 points for Utah (2-3). 
JAZZ: With Gordon Hayward (back contusion), Derrick Favors (back) and Rudy Gobert (rest) on the sidelines, Utah gave 7-foot-3 German rookie Tibor Pleiss and Rodney Hood their first starts of the preseason. Pleiss had two points and five rebounds in 19 minutes. Hayward took a hard fall in an Oct. 12 game against Portland, is considered day-to-day. 
BLAZERS: Maurice Harkless made his first preseason start, replacing Al Farouq Aminu (rest). The 6-9 forward, who had played just 44 minutes in two previous preseason games, had eight points and nine rebounds.
